item.title: Mandy add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Nicholas Sparks
item.description: "I am nothing special, of this I am sure. I am a common man with common thoughts and I've led a common life. There are no monuments dedicated to me and my name will soon be forgotten, but I've loved another with all my heart and soul, and to me, this has always been enough.." -- Nicholas Sparks

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in; forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day. You shall begin it serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Fannie Brice
item.description: "Let the world know you as you are, not as you think you should be." -- Fannie Brice

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Siddhārtha Gautama
item.description: "Whatever a monk keeps pursuing with his thinking and pondering, that becomes the inclination of his awareness." -- Siddhārtha Gautama

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Henry Ward Beecherr
item.description: "Where is human nature so weak as in the bookstore?" -- Henry Ward Beecherr

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Tony Robbins
item.description: "If you do what you've always done, you'll get what you've always gotten. " -- Tony Robbins

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "The one way of tolerating existence is to lose oneself in literature as in a perpetual orgy." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Mandy add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Paul Auster
item.description: "One should never underestimate the power of books." -- Paul Auster

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Geraldine Brooks
item.description: "For to know a man's library is, in some measure, to know his mind." -- Geraldine Brooks

item.title: Mandy add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "I am simply a 'book drunkard.' Books have the same irresistible temptation for me that liquor has for its devotee. I cannot withstand them." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Arnold Lobel
item.description: "Books to the ceiling, Books to the sky, My pile of books is a mile high. How I love them! How I need them! I'll have a long beard by the time I read them." -- Arnold Lobel

item.title: Mandy add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "Your memory is a monster; you forget—it doesn't. It simply files things away. It keeps things for you, or hides things from you—and summons them to your recall with will of its own. You think you have a memory; but it has you!" -- John Irving

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Mason Cooley
item.description: "Reading gives us someplace to go when we have to stay where we are." -- Mason Cooley

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Jim Rohn
item.description: "There are two types of pain you will go through in life, the pain of discipline and the pain of regret. Discipline weighs ounces while regret weighs tonnes." -- Jim Rohn

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book." -- Groucho Marx
